page.title: 01INTRODUCTION
page.content: The twelve square kilometre area we have studied for the Domesday Project covers a sparsely populated part in the south of the county of Hereford and Worcester. During the Roman occupation it was the site of an important iron smelting town,on the direct route west from Gloucester.Today it is a peaceful farming community which has not outwardly changed much through the years. We have tried to show you life as it is today.We have looked at farms,at all the small industries in our area. There is a detailed breakdown of housing here and we have looked at aspects of natural history.We have looked at life-styles today and compared them with those of eighty years ago.Finally we have tried to show what matters to us today.
